intro: Paraselinum, commonly known as the parasitic sedge, is a flowering plant that belongs to the family Cyperaceae. It is a hemiparasitic plant, meaning it can photosynthesize but also derives some of its nutrients from host plants. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy areas and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually green or brown and lack showy petals. Paraselinum plays a role in its ecosystem by influencing the growth of its host plants and providing habitat for various small organisms.
